etymology.description: 爪(爪) (zhǎo, "hand") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") + 石(石) (shí, "stone") = borrowing with hands holding a stone -> phonetic borrowing
etymology.interpretation: The character 叚 originally depicted two hands grasping a stone, symbolizing the concept of 'borrowing'. The stone component was later used to indicate the pronunciation, reflecting its use in a phonetic context.
